alert.note: Alert for Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 4:45PM EDT until July 05 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following county, Wake. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 442 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Minor flooding is occurring near the intersection of Wade Ave and Capital Blvd. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Raleigh, Cary, RDU International, Morrisville and William B Umstead State Park. - This includes the following flood prone locations... Capital Blvd and Wade Ave, Pigeon House Creek at Cameron Village in Raleigh, Blue Ridge Rd, Glenwood Ave and Lead Mine Rd Intersection, Milburnie Rd near New Bern Ave, Dana Drive at Walnut Creek and Bailey Drive near Walnut Creek.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads.
